overview.description:
# Commands Overview
**Play**: Play a song from YouTube by providing a name or the link to it, or play a YouTube playlist, or use to resume a song that is currently playing.
**Pause**: Pause the song that is currently playing.
**Resume**: Resume the song that is currently playing.
**Skip**: Skip the song that is currently playing
**Stop**: Stop playing and remove all songs from the queue.
**Queue**: Clear the current queue of songs.
**Skipto**: Skip to the song in the queue at a given position (between 1 and the number of songs in the queue).
**Remove**: Remove a song from the queue at a given position.
**Help**: Show this message.
Use `/help <command>` to get more details about how to use the command. (Work in progress)

play.description:
## How to use `/play`
There are three modes for using this command.
1. `/play` to resume the currently playing song.
2. `/play <name/link>`
	Where name/link can be one of two things:
    * The name of the song you want to play. As it searches through YouTube and plays the first result, you should be specific with the name.
  * The link to the YouTube video.
3. `/play <playlist link>`
	Where `playlist_link` is the link to the YouTube playlist. (This feature is still work in progress so it will only add the first five videos to the queue.

pause.description:
## How to use `/pause`
If there is a currently playing song, use `/pause` to pause it.

resume.description:
## How to use `/resume`
If you paused a song with `/pause`, use `/resume` to ||resume it||.

skip.description:
## How to use `/skip`
Use `/skip` to skip over the currently playing song and move on to the next song in the queue.

stop.description:
## How to use `/stop`
Use `/stop` to make the music player stop playing the current song, clear the queue and leave the voice channel. It is equivalent to exiting a program.

queue.description:
## How to use `/queue`
Use `/queue` to display all the songs that are currently in the queue.

clear.description:
## How to use `/clear`
Use `/clear` all songs that are currently in the queue.

skipto.description:
## How to use `/skipto`
Use `/skipto <position>` to skip to the song in the queue at the specified position.
`position` is a number between 1 and the number of songs in the queue which is the position of the specified song. If you are specifying a position bigger than the number of songs in the queue, nothing will happen.

remove.description:
## How to use `/remove`
Use `/remove <position>` to remove the song in the queue at the specified position.
`position` is a number between 1 and the number of songs in the queue which is the position of the specified song. If you are specifying a position bigger than the number of songs in the queue, nothing will happen.

fuckyoudavid.description:
## How to use `/fuckyoudavid`
As David likes to say, "fuck around and find out". Use at your own risk.
